sentence: Chicago, IL - January 13, 2012 - Four free stock picks are being made available today on Zacks.com.

The industry's leading independent research firm highlights one Zacks #1 Rank Strong Buy or a Zacks #2 Rank Buy stock for each of the four main styles of investing: Aggressive Growth, Growth & Income, Momentum, and Value.
The four highlighted picks are: Questcor Pharmaceuticals ( QCOR ), The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ), Rayonier Inc ( RYN ) and Titan International, Inc. ( TWI ).
Today, Zacks is promoting its ''Buy'' stock recommendations.
Four daily picks are offered free.

http://at.zacks.com/?id=88

From 1988 through the present - a period that included serious corrections and recessions - the Zacks #1 Rank Stocks have nearly tripled the market with a fully documented average gain of +28% per year.

Here is a summary of today's selected stocks that are now highly rated by Zacks:

Questcor Pharmaceuticals fights the drama and as its earnings estimates move higher making it a Zanks #1 Rank (Strong Buy).
The Home Depot, Inc. continues to deliver strong results in a challenging environment.
Could Rayonier be the best derivative play for the housing market recovery?
Titan International, Inc. is expecting 2012 to be its best year ever.
That's a bold statement given all of the global economic uncertainty hanging in the air.
But this Zacks #2 Rank (Buy) does have the magic combination of both growth and value, with earnings expected to rise by the double digits in 2012 and a forward P/E of just 9.3.

How to Regularly Access Top Zacks Rank Picks for Free - http://at.zacks.com/?id=7154

Underlying the four free stock picks is a simple truth that first appeared in a Financial Analysts Journal article published in 1979.
Leonard Zacks, a Ph.D. from M.I.T.
found that "earnings estimate revisions are the most powerful force impacting stock prices."
Zacks #1 Rank is awarded to a stock when analysts sharply upgrade their estimates of what the company will earn.

Today, Zacks is promoting its stock recommendations by offering four daily picks free to those who register here: http://at.zacks.com/?id=7155

Zacks.com is a property of Zacks Investment Research, Inc., which was formed in 1978 by Len Zacks.
The company continually processes stock reports issued by 3,000 analysts from 150 brokerage firms.
It monitors more than 200,000 earnings estimates, looking for changes.
Then, when changes are discovered, they're applied to help assign more than 4,400 stocks into five Zacks Rank categories: #1 Strong Buy, #2 Buy, #3 Hold, #4 Sell, and #5 Strong Sell.
This proprietary stock-picking system continues to outperform the market by a nearly 3-to-1 margin.
Each weekday, new Zacks #1 Rank or Zacks #2 Rank stock picks are released on the free email newsletter, Profit from the Pros .

Investors are invited to register for their free subscription here: http://at.zacks.com/?id=91
